content: <xml>   <records>        <record>       <contributors>         <authors>           <author>Bormontov Evgeny Nikolaevich</author>           <author>Klukin Vladimir Ivanovich</author>           <author>Turikov Dmitry Aleksandrovich</author>           <author>Yakubovsky Dmitry</author>         </authors>       </contributors>       <titles>         <title>OPTIMIZATION OF ANN-TRAINING GEOMETRIC ALGORITHM IN INDEPENDENT COMPONENT ANALYSIS (ICA)</title>         <secondary-title/>       </titles>       <doi>10.5281/zenodo.10136</doi>       <pages/>       <volume/>       <number/>       <keywords>         <keyword>artificial neural networks, ANN-training algorithms, mixed signal processing, geometric algorythms</keyword>       </keywords>       <dates>         <year>2014</year>         <pub-dates>           <date>2014-05-01</date>         </pub-dates>       </dates>       <abstract><p>One of the most actual tasks of information processing today is the problem of separating a mixture of several sources of signals. Moreover, the solution requires the on-line processing mode. With this task successfully cope artificial neural networks (ANN). But for stable operation of the system, the ANN require training on specific algorithms. This article discusses a modification one of ANN-training geometric algorithms - histGEO.</p></abstract>     </record>      </records> </xml>
